subject: Investing
title: Bond Funds vs. Individual Bonds
description: A 60-second lesson on Bond Funds vs. Individual Bonds.

hook.text: A bond fund holds hundreds of bonds and trades daily. An individual bond sits quietly until maturity. Different tools.

buildup.text: Bond funds offer instant diversification and liquidity. You can sell any day. Individual bonds lock you to one issuer.

discovery.text: Individual bonds guarantee your principal back at maturity. Bond funds don't â€” their value fluctuates constantly.

twist.text: Bond funds never mature. They perpetually buy and sell, which means you're always exposed to current market prices.

climax.text: For most investors, bond index funds are simpler. For retirees needing guaranteed payouts, individuals may win.

punchline.text: Funds offer convenience. Individual bonds offer certainty. Choose your priority.

quiz.question: What is a key advantage of individual bonds over bond funds?
options: Guaranteed return of principal at maturity
